question_text:
Question 19 
[Geotechnical Engineering : Origin of Soil & Their Properties]
Consider the statements P and Q.

PAGE
14

P: Soil particles formed by mechanical weathering, and close to their origin are generally subrounded.
Q: Activity of the clay physically signifies its swell potential.
Which one of the following options is CORRECT?
(A) Both P and Q are TRUE 
(B) P is TRUE and Q is FALSE
(C) Both P and Q are FALSE 
(D) P is FALSE and Q is TRUE
explanation_text:
Sol.
 
• 
In mechanical weathering bulky sub-rounded particles are formed. Small sand particles located close 
to their origin are generally very angular sand particles carried by wind and running water are  sub 
angular to rounded in shape.
• 
Activity number is used to study the swelling behavior of clay soil.
Activity number 


C
A
Plasticityindex
= %of claysized particlesinsoil

c

0.75

Active
Hence, the correct option is (D).
